title: Decreased reserve ratio impacts TR, multiplier, MS

content.question: Assume that banks hold no excess reserves. A decrease in the required reserve ratio will cause total reserves in banks, the money multiplier, and the money supply to change in which of the following ways?

choices.label: Total Reserves Money Multiplier Money Supply Increase Increase Increase
Total Reserves Money Multiplier Money Supply Increase No change Increase
Total Reserves Money Multiplier Money Supply No change Increase Decrease
Total Reserves Money Multiplier Money Supply Decrease Decrease Decrease
Total Reserves Money Multiplier Money Supply No change Increase Increase

content.answer: Total Reserves Money Multiplier Money Supply No change Increase Increase

topic.text: 4.4: Banking and the Expansion of the Money Supply

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine the effect(s) of one or more changes on other economic markets.
